definition: nail/to follow closely/to keep at sb (to do sth)/variant of 盯[ding1]
to join things together by fixing them in place at one or more points/to nail/to pin/to staple/to sew on

sentences.english: When you've fastened the boards, tie the strings off so that they don't slip.
sentences.chinese: 木板釘牢後，把繩子打結繫緊，免得鬆脫。

sentences.english: You will have to fasten the lid down with nails .
sentences.chinese: 你必須用釘子把蓋子釘牢。

sentences.english: Use the battens of two by one inches and steel nails for nailing to the wall.
sentences.chinese: 由一個使用條板二移動和釘牢的鋼釘子對牆壁。

sentences.english: A conductive spike is created thus causing a dead short.
sentences.chinese: 一導電用大釘釘牢如此創造引起死者。

sentences.english: Will you nail down that loose board in the floor?
sentences.chinese: 請你把那塊鬆動的地板釘牢好嗎？

sentences.english: The carpenter kept pounding at the nail until he drove it home.
sentences.chinese: 那根釘子，直到把它釘牢爲止。

sentences.english: I nail the carpet down to ground.
The deck chairs have been put up for the winter.
sentences.chinese: 鴻漸和辛楣並坐在釘牢甲板上的長椅子上。

sentences.english: These nails are too small to hold the box together.
sentences.chinese: 這些釘子太小了，不能把箱子釘牢。

sentences.english: Hung-chien and Hsin-mei sat in the lounge chairs, which were nailed to the deck.
sentences.chinese: 鴻漸和辛楣並坐在釘牢甲板上的長椅子上。

sentences.english: The roof was never securely battened down.
The girder was clinched into the wall.
He stayed at home and nailed up the mail slot.
sentences.chinese: 他在家準備把那個郵箱釘牢了。

sentences.english: The worker battened down the loose windows.
sentences.chinese: 工人用板條釘牢鬆脫的窗戶。

sentences.english: Will you nail down that loose board in the floor ?
sentences.chinese: 請你把那塊鬆動的地板釘牢好嗎？

sentences.english: He was busy battening down all the shutters and doors.
sentences.chinese: 他正忙着用板條釘牢所有的百葉窗和門。
